provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses, as per Table 2
provenance.rationale: CT scan is explicitly stated as the primary imaging modality to be used for the evaluation of tumor responses.

provenance.textSnippet: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) can be conducted in cases where local laws/requirements mandate, but should have Sponsor approval prior to performing the MRI.
provenance.rationale: MRI is explicitly mentioned as an alternative imaging modality for tumor assessments under specific conditions.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The chest is explicitly defined as a body region to be evaluated by CT scan for tumor response.

provenance.textSnippet: A CT scan of the full chest and abdomen (with image of liver and adrenal glands) will be used in the evaluation of tumor responses
provenance.rationale: The abdomen is explicitly defined as a body region to be evaluated by CT scan for tumor response.

provenance.textSnippet: A baseline MRI (or CT if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain is to be performed on any subject with signs or symptoms suggesting CNS involvement by tumor.
provenance.rationale: A scan of the brain (via MRI or CT) is explicitly required as part of tumor assessments for subjects with suspected CNS involvement.

provenance.textSnippet: Radiographic information will be collected to determine response according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1.
provenance.rationale: RECIST version 1.1 is explicitly stated as the criteria for determining tumor response from radiographic information.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines the imaging modalities (CT, MRI), body regions (chest, abdomen, brain), and assessment criteria (RECIST 1.1) for Tumor Assessments in the 'Tumor Assessments (Radiologic)' section (page 48) and Appendix H (page 114).

components.name: NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)

provenance.textSnippet: To assess the subject's health-related quality of life and symptoms, two questionnaires will be administered: the NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17)
provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly named as one of the two instruments used for the Quality of Life assessment in the protocol.

provenance.textSnippet: To assess the subject's health-related quality of life and symptoms, two questionnaires will be administered: ...and the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D-5L).
provenance.rationale: This questionnaire is explicitly named as one of the two instruments used for the Quality of Life assessment in the protocol.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines two questionnaires on page 50: NCCN-Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 (NFLSI-17) and European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D-5L). This is also confirmed on page 9.

provenance.textSnippet: Approximately 3 mL of blood will be collected by venipuncture for veliparib concentrations at 0 hours (just before morning dose of veliparib) and other timepoints as specified per Table 4.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly states that blood samples are collected for the purpose of measuring veliparib concentrations.

provenance.textSnippet: Plasma concentrations of veliparib metabolite(s) may be determined using validated or non-validated methods.

expansions.rationale: The protocol explicitly defines the analytes to be measured from the pharmacokinetic samples on page 53, including veliparib concentration and veliparib metabolite(s) concentration.
